content.title: Scholarship To Scheduled Castes Students Studying In Government ITI’s
content.department: Department of Welfare of Scheduled Castes & Backward Classes, Government of Haryana
content.beneficiary: Scheduled Castes students studying in Government ITI's
content.details: The scheme 'Scholarship to Scheduled Castes Students Studying in Government ITI’s' was launched by the Department of Welfare of Scheduled Castes & Backward Classes, Government of Haryana in the year 2017-18. This scheme is implemented through Skill Development and Industrial Training Department, Haryana. The funds will be provided by this department to Skill Development and Industrial Training Department, Haryana according to their requirement. The objective of the scheme is to promote the interest of skill development training in Scheduled Castes youths and to enable them for self-employment and get jobs in Private & Government Sectors. The scheme is 100% funded by the State Government of Haryana.
benefits: The scholarship of ₹200/- per month will be given to the student of Scheduled Caste in each academic year.
Under the scheme, ₹15/- per month as tuition fee will be reimbursed.
eligibility: The Scholarship will be given to all Scheduled Castes students who are studying in Government ITI's situated in Haryana State.
The students should belong to the Scheduled Castes of Haryana.
The student should be a resident of Haryana State.
exclusions: The students taking benefits of this scheme will not be eligible to get benefits under any other State/Central Scheme.
content.application_process: The eligible students should contact to their Head/Principal of ITI's in which they are studying and collect the application form for the scholarship. Fill in all necessary details in the application form. The completely filled application form along with all the necessary attachments should be submitted to concerned receiving authority in their institute. After successful verification, the students shall be eligible to get the benefits of the scheme.
documents_required: Last Exam Passed Certificate (Except for 1st Year Students)
An affidavit that the student is not taking benefit of any other State/Central scheme.

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The objective of the scheme is to promote the interest in skill development training in Scheduled Castes youths and to enable them to self-employment and get jobs in Private & Government Sectors.

faqs.question: Which is the implementing department of the scheme?
faqs.answer: Skill Development and Industrial Training Department, Haryana.

faqs.question: Which department has launched this scheme?
faqs.answer: Welfare of Scheduled Castes & Backward Classes Department, Government of Haryana.

faqs.question: When was this scheme started?
faqs.answer: This scheme was started in the year 2017-18.

faqs.question: What is the benefit of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The scholarship of ₹200/- per month will be given to the student of Scheduled Caste in each academic year.

faqs.question: How much will the tuition fee be reimbursed under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Under the scheme, ₹15/- per month as tuition fee will be reimbursed.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to get the benefits of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The Scholarship will be given to all Scheduled Castes students who are studying in Government ITI's situated in Haryana State.

faqs.question: Is this scheme only for a permanent resident of Haryana State?
faqs.answer: Yes, the student should be a resident of Haryana State.

faqs.question: Can a general category student apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: No, this scheme is only for the Scheduled Castes of Haryana State.

faqs.question: Is this scheme 100% sponsored by the state government?
faqs.answer: Yes, this scheme is 100% funded by the State Government of Haryana.

faqs.question: How will the payment of the scholarship be made?
faqs.answer: The payment of the scholarship will be made to students through their Aadhaar-linked bank account instead of cash payment.

faqs.question: How can a student apply under the scheme?
faqs.answer: The eligible student may apply through both the online & offline modes.

faqs.question: How can a student apply through offline mode?
faqs.answer: The eligible students should contact the Head/Principal of ITI's in which they are studying and collect the application form for the scholarship.

faqs.question: How can a student apply online mode?
faqs.answer: The eligible students may apply through Centralized Scholarship Portal.
